item.name: Send order to SSMv2 through Nissan Europe DMS

exec: pm.test("IFM Basket has been created", function () {

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:dms="http://eu.nissan.biz/DMSinterface">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<dms:Quotation_request>
<dms:input>
<dms:VIN>SJNFAAJ11U1000347</dms:VIN>
<dms:RegistrationNumber>EW364AK</dms:RegistrationNumber>
<dms:CarMileage>30000</dms:CarMileage>
<dms:CustomerNumber>13</dms:CustomerNumber>
<dms:CustomerLastName>Peter</dms:CustomerLastName>
<dms:CustomerFirstName>David</dms:CustomerFirstName>
<dms:CustomerAddressLine1>13</dms:CustomerAddressLine1>
<dms:CustomerAddressCity>Belrose</dms:CustomerAddressCity>
<dms:CustomerAddressRegion>Sydney</dms:CustomerAddressRegion>
<dms:CustomerAddressPostalCode>12345</dms:CustomerAddressPostalCode>
<dms:CustomerTelephoneNumber>1234567890</dms:CustomerTelephoneNumber>
<dms:CustomerFaxNumber>0987654321</dms:CustomerFaxNumber>
<dms:CustomerEmailAddress>tzhu@email.com</dms:CustomerEmailAddress>
<dms:FiscalCode>fcode</dms:FiscalCode>
<dms:ServiceAdvisorFullName>Service Advisor</dms:ServiceAdvisorFullName>
</dms:input>
</dms:Quotation_request>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

item.name: Retrieve order from SSMv2 through Nissan Europe DMS

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:dms="http://eu.nissan.biz/DMSinterface">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<dms:Quotation_result>
<!-- put quote ID here to retrieve order, add operations to quote before retrieving -->
<dms:BasketID>5b10ccb1e4b03cae45757f00</dms:BasketID>
</dms:Quotation_result>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:dms="http://eu.nissan.biz/DMSinterface">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<dms:Quotation_result>
<!-- put quote ID here to retrieve order, add operations to quote before retrieving -->
<dms:BasketID>{{nissTechnical_quoteID}}</dms:BasketID>
</dms:Quotation_result>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:dms="http://eu.nissan.biz/DMSinterface">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<dms:Quotation_result>
<!-- put quote ID here to retrieve order, add operations to quote before retrieving -->
<dms:BasketID>{{nissCommercial_quoteID}}</dms:BasketID>
</dms:Quotation_result>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

item.description:
This test case is for a Toyota user that has multi-site access to another Toyota account. 

Subscriber user has access to Site A (primary) and has multi-site access to Site B.
Subscription holder user has access to site B only.

item.description:
This test case is for a Toyota user that has multi-site access to a Nissan account (which in turn has multi-site access to the original Toyota account), i.e. both users here are subscribers to the other account.

Toyota user belongs to Site A (primary) and has multi-site access to Site B.
- This user also has access to Site C (QA TGB Account) which is not referenced in test cases.

Nissan user belongs to Site B (primary) and has multi-site access to Site A.
- This user also has access to Site D (SSMQA Nissan GB) which is not referenced in test cases.


The tests here are ordered by User/Site. So where it says 'TME/Nissan' it means that we have authorised the TME user but are checking a response in the Nissan site.
Automated testing steps for Multi-site accounts in Production.

exec: pm.expect(jsonData.operations[0].description).to.eql("0C4C53: Carry out 45,000km service as per handbook.");
pm.expect(jsonData.operations[0].description).to.eql("0C4C53: Carry out 45,000km service as per handbook.");
